title: Eminent Domain Records for Address: 108 Greenlawn Avenue, Bensenville, IL, 60106 (Cook County State's Attorney's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Information regarding the removal of a former home at address, 108 Greenlawn Avenue, Bensenville, IL, 60106, due to eminent domain. 

List of actions taken throughout eminent domain process for address, 108 Greenlawn Avenue, Bensenville, IL, 60106, that provide historical record of all actions related to eminent domain:

-Rational for eminent domain 

-Engagement with homeowner and communication with homeowner explaining process for eminent domain 

-A timeline for when and how home was destroyed 

-The current status and use of the land where the home was located

-Any and all information related to the home and its eminent domain case 


If information is not available due to privacy reasons, please provide any and all information related to the surrounding neighborhood/area where eminent domain was completed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sebastian Villa Rodriguez

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sebastian Villa-Rodriguez
